data.title: Gold rises to all-time high on Sino-US tariff war
data.description:
Spot gold was up 0.2% at $2,848.69 per ounce, as of 0253 GMT, after hitting a record high of $2,853.97 earlier in the session.

Gold prices hit a record high on Wednesday, bolstered by fears of a new trade war between the United States and China after Beijing slapped tariffs on U.S. imports in a response to new U.S. duties on Chinese goods.

Spot gold was up 0.2% at $2,848.69 per ounce, as of 0253 GMT, after hitting a record high of $2,853.97 earlier in the session. US gold futures gained 0.2% to $2,879.70.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

US President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he is in no hurry to speak to Chinese President Xi Jinping to try to defuse the trade tensions between the world’s two largest economies.

China imposed targeted tariffs on U.S. imports on Tuesday and put several companies, including Google, on notice for possible sanctions, in a measured response to Trump’s tariffs.

"The next major inflection point for gold is probably the $3,000 figure… China may be more encouraged to keep buying gold for reserves if the trade war escalates," said Ilya Spivak, head of global macro at Tastylive.

Meanwhile, the Trump administration’s plans for trade tariffs come with inflation risks, three Federal Reserve officials warned on Monday, with one arguing that uncertainty over the price outlook calls for slower interest rate cuts than otherwise.

While gold is considered an inflation hedge, higher interest rates could dampen its appeal among investors.

Key economic data on investors’ radar this week includes the ADP employment report due at 1315 GMT and the payrolls report on Friday, which could shed more light on the health of the U.S. economy.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

"Gold demand ought to be partially supportive for other precious metals but their sensitivity to risk appetite has seen them underperform," said Spivak.

Spot silver rose 0.2% to $32.15 per ounce, platinum edged 0.3% higher to $966.95, and palladium fell 0.9% to $981.75.
data.author: MoneyControl

data.title: Tata Power shares gain 3% following strong Q3 earnings, brokerages mixed on outlook
data.description:
Tata Power Company's stock price has slipped 15 percent over the previous three months.

Shares of Tata Power Company rose 3 percent to Rs 373 on February 5 after the company reported a 10 percent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 1,188 crore for the third quarter of FY24-25, surpassing expectations. The earnings boost was attributed to better realization across its core businesses—generation, transmission, distribution, and renewables.

Revenue grew 3 percent to Rs 15,793 crore, while EBITDA rose 7 percent to Rs 3,481 crore, driven by operational efficiencies and business synergies. CEO and MD Praveer Sinha highlighted the company’s consistent profit growth over 21 quarters, underscoring contributions from all segments.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates

Brokerages, however, remained divided on the stock. Nuvama maintained a "Reduce" rating with a target price of Rs 343, noting that growth was driven by one-off income from the Mundra plant. While the company is ramping up solar module and cell manufacturing, Nuvama believes risks outweigh rewards at the current valuation of 2.9 times FY26 estimated price-to-book value.

Morgan Stanley remained bullish with an "Overweight" call and a target of Rs 583 per share, despite weaker-than-expected numbers across most business segments except for Mumbai and Odisha discoms. The firm highlighted a planned capex spend of Rs 10,000 crore in Q4 and guided for 600 MW of renewable energy commissioning in the same period.

Also read: Asia shares edge higher, dollar backtracks amid hopes US tariffs won't be painful

CLSA, however, maintained an "Underperform" rating with a target price of Rs 351, citing weak Q3 results led by subsidiary Tata Projects, which pulled PAT down by 6 percent year-on-year. Profitability in the company’s renewable independent power producer (IPP) business was hit by lower solar and wind utilization rates and rising interest costs. Additionally, coal profit per tonne fell 17 percent year-on-year due to a decline in seaborne coal prices. The only bright spot was the renewable energy EPC business, which benefited from India’s solar module import ban.

Tata Power’s renewable push continued with Tata Power Renewable Energy Ltd (TPREL) commissioning a 126 MWp floating solar project in Omkareshwar and a 431 MW DC solar plant in Neemuch, Madhya Pradesh—the latter being India’s first to integrate single-axis trackers with bi-facial modules. The company also hit a milestone of 16 lakh smart meter installations across its discoms in Mumbai, Delhi, and Odisha.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad
Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

Read more: Hero MotoCorp Q3 Preview: Weak domestic demand, motorcycle sales to keep earnings growth muted

At about 9:20 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs370, higher by 2.2 percent from the last close on the NSE. Tata Power Company's stock price has slipped 15 percent over the previous three months.

Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

data.title: Blue Dart shares rise 2% as Goldman Sachs maintains 'buy', sees 22% upside
data.description:
Blue Dart Express's share price has tanked over 18 percent in the last three months.

Shares of Blue Dart Express rallied over 2 percent to Rs 6,543 in morning trade on February 5, snapping its three-day losing streak on the bourses after Goldman Sachs maintained a "Buy" rating on the stock and raised the target price.

With a buy call, the international brokerage assigned a price target of Rs 7,720, implying an upside potential of 22 percent from the last closing price of Rs 6,383 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE).

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates

The brokerage maintained its rating even as the company's second quarter revenue and EBITDA missed estimates by 2 percent and 6 percent, respectively. Parcel volume grew 7 percent year-on-year, while tonnage increased 12 percent, with surface transport outpacing air freight. However, freight margins deteriorated by 10 basis points quarter-on-quarter, contrary to the 80 basis points expansion Goldman had expected. The brokerage finds Blue Dart's valuation attractive at 27 times its estimated FY27 earnings.

Blue Dart reported a strong sequential performance in Q3 FY25, with consolidated net profit rising 28.9 percent to Rs 81.01 crore from Rs 62.84 crore in the previous quarter. Total income grew 4.6 percent to Rs 1,523.65 crore, while profit before tax (PBT) surged 28.7 percent to Rs 109.26 crore.

However, on a year-on-year basis, net profit declined 8.9 percent, even as total income rose 9.3 percent. PBT saw a modest increase of 1.6 percent compared to the same period last year.

Managing Director Balfour Manuel highlighted the company’s resilience and adaptability, attributing its performance to a well-balanced mix of B2B and B2C solutions. He noted that disciplined execution and operational efficiency have enabled Blue Dart to navigate market challenges while maintaining consistent growth and long-term value.

Looking ahead, Manuel emphasized the company’s commitment to building a future-ready logistics ecosystem, with a focus on sustainability, scalability, and service excellence. Strategic investments in efficiency and environmental responsibility, he said, will ensure seamless and reliable logistics solutions for stakeholders.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

At about 9:20 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 6,462, higher by 1.3 percent from the last close on the NSE. Blue Dart Express's share price has tanked over 18 percent in the last three months.

Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

data.title: Lock-in expiry could see Swiggy, Ola Electric, NTPC Green, others offload Rs 70,500-crore shares in February
data.description:
More than two dozen companies, including well-known names like Swiggy, NTPC Green Energy, TVS Supply Chain, Northern Arc Capital, FirstCry, Ola Electric and Unicommerce Solutions among others, would see their respective IPO lock-in period expire in the current month, as per an analysis by Moneycontrol basis a report by Nuvama Institutional Equities.

At a time when Indian equities are seeing a lot of volatility with the benchmarks down nearly 9 percent from their record highs, shares worth nearly Rs 70,500 crore could enter the markets in February as the lock-in period of many recently-listed companies will come to an end.

More than two dozen companies, including well-known names like Swiggy, NTPC Green Energy, TVS Supply Chain, Northern Arc Capital, FirstCry, Ola Electric and Unicommerce Solutions among others, would see their respective IPO lock-in period expire in the current month, as per an analysis by Moneycontrol basis a report by Nuvama Institutional Equities.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

According to the report, Ola Electric would see the lock-in period expire for the biggest chunk of shares in terms of number as 1962.2 million shares will see their lock-in period expire on February 10.

It will be followed by companies like FirstCry (335.3 million), SBFC Finance (225.5 million), NTPC Green Energy (183.3 million), Sagility India (157.6 million), Juniper Hotels (128 million), Ceigall India (108.1 million) and Premier Energies (105.6 million) that will see over 100 million shares each exit the lock-in period.

To be sure, it is not necessary that the shares will be sold as soon as the lock-in period expires. But owners of the shares will at least have the option to sell if they want to.

Meanwhile, in terms of the value of the lock-in shares eligible to be sold in the open market, FirstCry could see the largest chunk at Rs 15,979 crore, followed by Ola Electric at Rs 14691 crore and Premier Energies at Rs 10752 crore.

Some of the other companies with a potential sale value in excess of Rs 1,000 crore include Concord Biotech (Rs 4,665 crore), Juniper Hotels (Rs 3747 crore), Ceigall India (Rs 3,184 crore), Swiggy (Rs 2827 crore), NTPC Green Energy (Rs 2038 crore), Northern Arc Capital (Rs 1971 crore), SBFC Finance (Rs 1913 crore), TVS Supply Chain (Rs 1271 crore) and Interarch Building  (Rs 1052 crore).

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

Some of the other companies that would see the lock-in period end in February are Capital Infra Trust, Sagility India, BLS E Services, Unicommerce Solutions, ACME Solar, Saraswati Saree Depot, Enviro Infra, Quadrant Future and Stallion India among others.

Meanwhile, as per the report by Nuvama, the total potential value of share sale till April 30 could be around $32 billion as more than 80 companies would see their respective lock-in period end.

Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

data.title: Hero MotoCorp Q3 Preview: Weak domestic demand, motorcycle sales to keep earnings growth muted
data.description:
The Hero MotoCorp stock has tanked over 11 percent in the past three months.

Delhi-headquartered Hero MotoCorp Limited is set to release its earnings report for the third fiscal quarter of FY25 on February 6. Analysts expect muted growth in revenue, led by low motorcycle sales and a weak domestic market. Margins could face pressure due to higher discounts and rising electric vehicle (EV) contributions.

According to a Moneycontrol poll of seven brokerage firms, the Harley Davidson maker is anticipated to record a 3.8 percent year-on-year increase in revenue to Rs 10,099 crore. Net profit is projected to rise 4 percent to Rs 1,114 crore from Rs 1,073 crore in the same quarter of the previous fiscal year.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates

Earnings estimates from analysts polled by Moneycontrol are in a narrow range, indicating that any positive or negative surprises could trigger a sharp reaction in the stock price.

What factors are driving Hero MotoCorp's earnings?

Analysts suggest that revenue growth and net profit could witness a marginal uptick while margins could contract amid large discounting and EV share.

EBITDA Contraction: EBITDA margins are expected to decline marginally year-on-year, primarily weighed down by a lower share of motorcycles, higher sales of lower-margin exports, festive season discounts, and a rise in EV sales. The company sold 14,63,802 units in the third quarter, just a tad higher than the 14,59,932 units sold in the same quarter of the previous fiscal.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad
Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

Market share recovery: Rural demand recovery due to good monsoons and government policies aided by new vehicle launches, to drive the market share recovery witnessed during the Diwali festive season.

Muted Revenue: Subdued motorcycle sales and a sluggish domestic market to keep revenue growth muted. However, a 15 percent rise in exports helped offset some of the impact. Blended realisations are expected to see a marginal 0.5 percent decline quarter-on-quarter due to an unfavourable product mix, though higher spare parts sales should provide some relief.

What to look out for in the quarterly show?

Key aspects to monitor in the earnings report include the outlook for domestic demand and the trajectory of export growth. Analysts will also focus on the timeline for upcoming product launches which will be crucial in shaping the company's growth trajectory in the coming quarters.

Hero MotoCorp shares closed at Rs 4,237, lower by 1.2 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hero MotoCorp share price has tanked nearly 12 percent in the last three months.

Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

data.title: Budget, Economic Survey again bat for greater control over regulators
data.description:
The Survey creates the pretext for closer monitoring of the regulators

Highlights

  • The Budget has proposed a framework to evaluate and enhance regulators’ effectiveness

  • FSDC, a non-statutory body, could now expand its remit beyond coordination and oversee some regulatory aspects

  • The Economic Survey creates the pretext for closer monitoring of the regulators

  • The Survey advocates regulatory impact assessment benchmarks and evaluating regulation from all angles

data.title: Short Call | Is this correction finally over? Tata Chemicals, Asian Paints in focus
data.description:
Short Call.

From January 27, the benchmark Nifty 50 index has soared over 4 percent, and settled above the 10 percent correction line. Does this mean the correction is over?

Let's look at the facts.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

1.Jefferies noted that in the past decade, 9 times out of 10, Nifty corrected alongside the EM index suggesting high global linkages. The MSCI EM Index corrected by 12 percent from Oct'24 peak thru to Jan bottom but the index is already up ~5 percent from the January bottom.

2. The market correction has been ongoing for 126 days, making it the 2nd longest of the 10 corrections in the last 10 years. Markets have corrected 10 times in the past 10 years.

3. Valuations: The brokerage noted that valuation indicators at 10-year average level now. Nifty is currently trading at 18.8x 1-yr fwd PE, which is still 3-4 percent above its 10-year average, but it has moderated from earlier highs. On a yield gap basis (Bond yield - Earnings yield), the valuation is now at 10-yr avg (145 bps). Historically, this has been a strong indicator of future returns, noted Jefferies.

4. The Indian rupee has been steadily weakening. However, the outlook can change materially to the positive, if DXY traces back to the September 2024 level. President Donald Trump wants a weaker USD and in his first term, DXY declined by 14 percent over the first 14 months, noted Jefferies.

So does this mean the ongoing correction has now come to an end? Well, that, only time and the markets can tell!

Tata Chemical (Rs 918.35, -3%)

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

Reported underwhelming Q3 numbers.

Bull Case: Soda ash prices are expected to scale a turnaround going ahead. Further, this quarter was hit by a one-time exceptional loss, on account of expenses related to employee termination benefits, decommissioning of plant and machinery, and other closure-related costs following the cessation of soda ash production at the Lostock plant in Northwich, UK.
Bear Case: In the short-term, the current demand-supply adverse situation is likely to persist but should improve and stabilise over the long term driven by growth sectors based on sustainability trend, said the management.

Asian Paints (Rs 2,355, +2.7%)

Net profit of Rs 1,128 cr in Q3, margin and volume beat estimates

Bull case: Despite near-term headwinds, Asian Paints' strong brand equity and leadership position in the decorative paints segment give it a long-term edge. Management anticipates a return to revenue growth in the coming quarters, suggesting that the worst of the slowdown may be behind the company.

Bear case: The company is grappling with its fourth straight quarter of revenue decline, with a deteriorating product mix further exacerbating the issue. Additionally, subdued demand and rising competitive pressure may continue to weigh on margins, making a swift recovery uncertain.

(With inputs from Lovisha.)
data.author: MoneyControl

data.title: Asian Paints Q3 show fails to impress brokerages, stress in urban demand to continue for few quarters
data.description:
Goldman Sachs reiterated its 'sell' call, with a price target of Rs 2,275 per share.

  • Watchlist
  • Portfolio
  • Message
  • Set Alert
 
 
live
  • bselive
  • nselive
Volume
Todays L/H
More

India's largest paints player Asian Paints Ltd.'s earnings show for the quarter failed to impress analysts, as most maintained their bearish calls or trimmed their bullish target prices.

Asian Paints reported a 23 percent drop in net profit at Rs 1,128 crore for the quarter ended December 31, 2024 hit by weak festive season demand. The paint maker reported net profit of Rs 1,475 crore in the year-ago period.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

The company's revenue declined 6 percent to Rs 8,549 crore in Q3FY25 as against Rs 9,103 crore in Q3FY24. The December quarter marked the fourth consecutive quarter of revenue decline for Asian Paints. However, the management foresees revenue growth returning within the next few quarters.

The paints major saw muted demand as a result of the weak festive season and lagging urban demand. Although the operating margins improved on a sequential basis but on a yearly basis, the margins remained impacted due to increased distribution expenses.

In the near term, the company remain cautiously optimistic on a recovery in demand conditions while it shall continue to invest in its brand and focus on innovation and customer centricity. Further, volume growth is likely to be in single-digits going forward, while EBITDA margins are likely to be 18–20 percent. Some softening is anticipated in raw material prices

Follow our live blog to catch all the updates

International brokerage Goldman Sachs maintained its 'sell' call, with a price target of Rs 2,275, as the near-term demand is likely to remain subdued. Further, the increased competitive intensity is likely to rise.

The demand outlook remains weak along with downtrading by customers, which led to an adverse product mix, noted Nuvama Institutional Equities. The rural outlook remains strong, but urban shall pick up only after two more quarters. The brokerage kept its 'buy' rating intact, but trimmed its estimates and target price to Rs 3,000 per share, down from Rs 3,185 apiece.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad
Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

data.title: Gold hits record high as US-China trade war stokes haven demand
data.description:
That came after President Donald Trump hit Chinese imports with a 10% tariff the day before, prompting a swift but more targeted retaliation from Beijing.

Gold rose to a record high, after advancing by almost 1% in the previous session, as the opening salvos of the US-China trade war stoked haven demand.

Bullion reached an all-time peak of $2,849.05 an ounce on Wednesday. That came after President Donald Trump hit Chinese imports with a 10% tariff the day before, prompting a swift but more targeted retaliation from Beijing.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

The response from China was relatively muted compared to Trump’s first term, when Beijing hit back with tariffs that were almost on par with the US, but there’s still plenty of trepidation about the impact on the world’s two biggest economies. Markets are also waiting to see if there are any ripple effects for US monetary policy if tariffs reignite inflation.

Adding to the uncertain outlook, Trump proposed that the US take over the Gaza Strip and assume responsibility for reconstructing the war-torn territory, during a press conference with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. The precious metal should benefit from increasing unease about what lies ahead, although may lose some of its luster if interest rates stay high.

A gauge of the dollar fell, extended losses following a US jobs report on Tuesday that pointed to a gradual slowdown in the labor market. A weaker greenback makes commodities like gold cheaper for most buyers.

“Who doesn’t like a safe-haven in this scenario?,” said Charu Chanana, a strategist at Saxo Capital Markets Pte.. “No good news on US-China talks and more geopolitical angst with the Gaza news would continue to provide a further boost to gold, irrespective of where the US dollar goes.”

Spot gold rose 0.1% to $2,844.82 an ounce as of 9:17 a.m. in Singapore. The Bloomberg Dollar Spot Index was down 0.1%, after a 0.7% loss on Tuesday. Silver and palladium dipped, while platinum edged higher.

Trade-war fears had jolted precious-metals markets even before Trump went ahead with the tariffs on China. US prices of gold and silver have surged above international benchmarks in recent weeks, prompting dealers and traders to rush huge volumes of the metals into America before any tariffs take effect. The chaos also led to a spike in lease rates for gold and silver — the return that holders of metal in London’s vaults can get by loaning it out on a short-term basis.
data.author: MoneyControl

data.description:

NLC India share price will remain in focus on February 5 following the company emerged as a successful bidder for new Patrapara South Coal Mine in Angul District of Odisha.

The coal mine block is having a total geological reserve of 720.87 million tonnes (Approximately) with a peak rated capacity of 12 million tonnes per annum.

Story continues below Advertisement
Remove Ad

This is the third commercial coal mine for the company, crossing 100 million tonnes of mining capacity commitment in line with its corporate plan 2030, company said.

Catch all the market action on our live blog

The company had reported 166.8 percent jump in its net profit at Rs 668.09 crore against Rs 250.42 crore in December 2023.

The revenue from operations was up 39.4 percent at Rs 4,411.41 crore against Rs 3,164.40 crore, YoY.

In January, the company's subsidiary, NLC India Renewables, has signed a Joint Venture Agreement with Assam Power Distribution Company for the development of a solar power project in Assam.
